xxl.core.pipes.operators.mappers
Class ReservoirSampler

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,O>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.mappers.Aggregator<Number,Number[]>
              xxl.core.pipes.operators.mappers.ReservoirSampler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<Number,Number[]>, Node, Sink<Number>, Source<Number[]>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class ReservoirSampler
extends Aggregator<Number,Number[]>

Operator component in a query graph that realizes online sampling as a special kind of an aggregation operator based on a reservoir sampling function.
Three different strategies available, that have been published in "[Vit85]: Jeffrey Scott Vitter, Random Sampling with a Reservoir, in ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software, Vol. 11, NO. 1, March 1985, Pages 37-57".

Example usage (1): 

        new Tester(
                new Mapper(
                        new ReservoirSampler(
                                new Enumerator(100, 10),
                                new ReservoirSample(10, new ReservoirSample.XType(10)) // sample's size is 10
                        ),
                        new Function() { // formatting output
                                protected int c = 0; 
 
                                public Object invoke(Object o) {
                                        Object[] next = (Object[])o;
                                        System.out.println(c++);
                                        if (next != null) {
                                                for (int i = 0; i < next.length; i++)
                                                        System.out.print(": " + next[i]);
                                                System.out.println();
                                        }
                                        else
                                                System.out.println(": reservoir not yet initialized!");
                                        return o;
                                }
                        }
                )
        );

Since:
1.1
See Also:
ReservoirSample, ContinuousRandomWrapper, DiscreteRandomWrapper

Field Detail

RTYPE

public static final int RTYPE
Indicates the use of type R for sampling strategy.

See Also:
ReservoirSample, ReservoirSample.RType, Constant Field Values

XTYPE

public static final int XTYPE
Indicates the use of type X for sampling strategy.

See Also:
ReservoirSample, ReservoirSample.XType, Constant Field Values

YTYPE

public static final int YTYPE
Indicates the use of type Y for sampling strategy. This type is not available so far due to the lack of information about the used distribution to determine the position in the reservoir for a sampled object.

See Also:
ReservoirSample, Constant Field Values

ZTYPE

public static final int ZTYPE
Indicates the use of type Z for sampling strategy.

See Also:
ReservoirSample, ReservoirSample.ZType, Constant Field Values

                        int type,
                        ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                        DiscreteRandomWrapper drw)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException

ReservoirSampler

public ReservoirSampler(Source<? extends Number> source,
                        int sourceID,
                        int n,
                        int type,
                        ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                        DiscreteRandomWrapper drw)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ReservoirSampler as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
n - Size of the sample to draw.
type - Strategy used to determine the position of the treated object in the sampling reservoir.
crw - PRNG for computing continuous random numbers.
drw - PRNG for computing discrete random numbers.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If an unknown sampling strategy has been specified.

ReservoirSampler

public ReservoirSampler(Source<? extends Number> source,
                        int n,
                        int type,
                        ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                        DiscreteRandomWrapper drw)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ReservoirSampler as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
n - Size of the sample to draw.
type - Strategy used to determine the position of the treated object in the sampling reservoir.
crw - PRNG for computing continuous random numbers.
drw - PRNG for computing discrete random numbers.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If an unknown sampling strategy has been specified.

ReservoirSampler

public ReservoirSampler(Source<? extends Number> source,
                        int n,
                        int type)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ReservoirSampler as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The input rate and the output rate are not measured.
Instances of the classes JavaContinuousRandomWrapper and JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper are used to generate the necessary random numbers.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
n - Size of the sample to draw.
type - Strategy used to determine the position of the treated object in the sampling reservoir.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If an unknown sampling strategy has been specified.

ReservoirSampler

public ReservoirSampler(Source<? extends Number> source,
                        int n,
                        ReservoirSample.ReservoirSamplingStrategy strategy)
Creates a new ReservoirSampler as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The input rate and the output rate are not measured.
Instances of the classes JavaContinuousRandomWrapper and JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper are used to generate the necessary random numbers.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
n - Size of the sample to draw.
strategy - strategy for an online reservoir sampling with size n.

ReservoirSampler

public ReservoirSampler(Source<? extends Number> source,
                        ReservoirSample reservoirSample)
Creates a new ReservoirSampler as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
reservoirSample - Function providing an online sampling.
